metadata.feature_description: Automatically authenticate users based on their IP address ranges

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure single IP address for auto-authentication

steps.action: Navigated to Admin > Extensions > Authentication Systems > Active Directory > Site Settings
steps.expected: Auto-login IP Address field should be visible
steps.actual: Auto-login IP Address field is visible with existing value 192.168.1.1

steps.action: Clicked Update Authentication Settings button to save single IP configuration
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, status message displayed (AD connection status shown as expected in test environment)

steps.action: Entered IP range '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.254' in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: IP range should be accepted in the field
steps.actual: IP range entered successfully in the field

steps.action: Clicked Update Authentication Settings button to save IP range configuration
steps.expected: IP range should be saved successfully
steps.actual: IP range configuration saved successfully, field retained the value after save

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test with multiple IP ranges separated by semicolons

steps.action: Entered multiple IP ranges '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.100;10.0.0.1-10.0.0.50;172.16.0.1' in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: Multiple IP ranges with semicolon separators should be accepted
steps.actual: Multiple IP ranges with semicolons entered successfully

steps.action: Clicked Update Authentication Settings button to save multiple IP ranges
steps.expected: Multiple IP ranges should be saved successfully
steps.actual: Multiple IP ranges configuration saved successfully

steps.action: Entered invalid IP address '192.168.1' (only 3 octets) in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: Invalid IP format should be rejected with error message

steps.action: Clicked Update Authentication Settings button with invalid IP
steps.actual: Error message displayed: '192.168.1 is not a valid IP address' - validation correctly rejected incomplete IP

observations: The Auto-login IP Address field is a multi-line textarea allowing for longer input values
IP validation requires full IPv4 format with 4 octets (e.g., 192.168.1.1)
IP ranges are specified using hyphen separator (e.g., 192.168.1.1-192.168.1.254)
Multiple IPs/ranges can be configured using semicolon separators
The Active Directory connection status (FAIL) is expected in test environment without actual AD server - this does not affect IP configuration functionality
Code review shows IP validation in Settings.ascx.cs CheckEnteredIPAddr() method validates each IP/range for proper 4-octet format
